item.title: Remembering the Friendly Club Casino: A Vintage Fremont Street Gem
item.description:
A Little Slice of Vegas Charm: The Friendly Club Casino

Downtown Las Vegas in the late 1970s and early 1980s was a fascinating mix. “Glitter Gulch,” as Fremont Street was then known, pulsed with neon and the promise of excitement. Towering resorts like the Golden Nugget and Binion’s Horseshoe vied for attention. But tucked amongst these behemoths existed smaller, more intimate casinos â€“ places that felt like neighborhood hangouts. One of the most fondly remembered of these was the Friendly Club Casino.
